Description: Marl pottery dish with interior thickening at rim, interior red slipped and burnished; exterior coated with a micaceous red slip, but not burnished. Smoothed around exterior rim only, rest of body is roughly scraped.
Curator's comments: Published: Art and Afterlife in Ancient Egypt (Japan 1999-2000): No 130. Like Polished red ware P24n in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
